lexUnit.definition: COD: a major division of time that is a subdivision of an aeon and is itself subdivided into periods.

sentence.text: The distinctive , sculpted marble figures of the era are now being reproduced in vast quantities as souvenirs .

The preeminent islands of this era were Delos , a sacred island and center of religion ruled by Athens ; Samos , ruled by the tyrant Polycrates ; and Naxos , whose ruler Lygdamis undertook some major building projects .
What happened next would mark the end of the successful Las Vegas Ranch and the beginning of the era of the subdivision seen across almost all of Western America to this day .
From where I am sitting , I think the Microsoft trial has been the really obvious turning point between the computer era and the digital age .
I often wonder when a really great fictional book will be written about this era ( probably decades and decades hence as it is too close ) .
Will the strongman of the era be AOL , AT and T , Microsoft , or one of the big media companies ?
The latest approach is perhaps the best of the post-mob era : the comprehensive resort .
Perhaps more important , such high-end accommodations raise the standards of expectations back to the mythology of the Rat Pack era .
This small formerly residential island , beautifully shaded by banyan trees , was the home of the closed community of the foreign colony in the era of `` concessions . ''
That era is gone now , but other elements of the island 's old life are preserved .

( NYT_ENG _20130625.0044 ) Meanwhile , in Pretoria , doctors continued to treat Mandela for a lung ailment that he contracted on Robben Island , the notorious apartheid-era prison where he spent much of his 27 years behind bars until his release in 1990 .
